data.question: What training related courses need to be completed before joing the Projects?
data.answer: Before joining TD Projects, mandatory training should be completed like Agile Way of wroking E1 (5376), Process Improvement E0 (1846), BCM E0 (5414)

data.question: What technology related courses need to be completed before joing the Projects?
data.answer: Before joining TD Projects, mandatory courses should be completed like Java , Spring, Spring Boot

data.question: What training need to be completed for UI Developer?
data.answer: HTML 5, Bootstrap, Angular.js, Angular 2+

data.question: What Mandatory  Training need to be completed before joing the Projects?
data.answer: Before joining TD Projects, Mandatory Training should be completed: Agile way of working(5376) , PI(1846), BCM(5414) , General Banking(3043), Cloud Computing(4142), MFDM(6125)

data.answer:

data.question: What if RSA Software is not install?
data.answer: Raise a CR ticket via Ultimatix. Steps: Ultimatix-->Global Help Desk-->IT Services

data.question: How to install VDI for project setup?
data.answer:
1. Install RSA Software
  2. Collect Domain ID and Manager name.
  3. Connect with your domain help desk or connect with TCS help desk if you are not able to connect directly with the Domain Help Desk.
  4. Confirm your Domain ID & ask them to provide temporary passowrd.
  5. They will call your manager for confirmation and will provide you with the Passowrd and ID.
  6. Turn on your system and login with your ID and Passoword.

    7. Setup is completed.

data.question: How to launch the VDI?
data.answer:
1. Once you log in, Storefront will present two Tabs. You will a see Favorites and Desktop menu TAB.
  2. On your first login, please select the Desktop TAB.
  3. Once in the Desktop tab, you will see your VM(s), and you can add any of them to your Favorites TAB by selecting Details and Add To Favorites. You may have a single VM icon if you have one VM, or multiple VM icon’s representing multiple VMs.
  4. The name of your VM ('id') is displayed bes'id'es the VM icon and will start with TVD**** in the “Detail” section. (Sample: TVD9C2A001)
  5. Once you add your VM to the Favorites tab, it will be displayed in favorites next time you login.
  6. You will then see a Connecting… screen shortly after launching the VM. Please note that launching your VM for the first time can take few minutes.

data.question: What is the process for Globe domain migration?
data.answer:
Steps for Global domain migration.
  1. Go to Global Helpdesk
  2. Click on Register RFC from drop down in My Links on top left.
  3. Identity Access Management
  4. Domain Account Migration within TCS & click Continue
  5. Select Expiry date as 1 year from the date of raising the RFC & select RFC Raised for Individual
  6. Click on Submit and Yes
    Note: No approval needed for this.
    Usual resolution time is 1day.So anyone can raise this request.

data.question: What is the process for OU migration?
data.answer:
Note:This request SHOULD be raised by team member NOT by PL.
    If a PL raises it then it will go to your DM for approval.
  1. Go to TCS Global Helpdesk
  2. Raise a new change request
  3. Fill all CR details, prerequisites is important.Process is automated, so it is driven off the prerequisites tab
  4. Fill change request description and other details carefully.
  5. And click Submit.
    This request goes to the PL for approval.
    So it is advisable for a team member to raise it so that the PL can approve.

data.question: What is the process for RFC for remote setup?
data.answer:
Note:This request is needed only in case of remote setup where-in the associate is in possession of a machine.If the associate does not have a machine, proceed to Final step: Final email for machine setup.
    This request SHOULD be raised by a team member NOT by a PL. If a PL raises it then it will go to DM for approval.
  1. Go to TCS Global Helpdesk
  2. Click on Register RFC from the drop down in My Links on top left
  3. Catelogue Details
  4. Access Management.
  5. Privilege/Profile Access-BPS
  6. Type of Access: Profile Access Rights.
  7. RFC raised for Individual & select start date and end date and click Continue.
  8. And click Submit.
    This request goes to the PL for approval.
    So it is advisable for a team member to raise it so that the PL can approve.

data.question: What is the process Final email for Machine detup?
data.answer:
After the RFC isresolved, you can drop an email to the IS team with Thivya Venkataramanan and the reporting manager for the resource in CC.
    S2 IS:heena.k2@tcs.com,amol.sathe@tcs.com
    S3 IS:utkarsh.jain@tcs.com,Vighnesh.pamdey1@tcs.com,
    Sahyadri.ISBOP@tcs.com
    For any email that is sent for remote setup below details need to be mentioned in the email
    Emp#
    Emp Name
    Contact#
    RSA token(should be attached in email)
    UX ticket# for TD remote machine setup.
    When the ticket is raised,please ensure that the associate location in ultimatix is set to TCS-Pune;SP-S2-Torna

data.question: Important points to Note.
data.answer:
• Whenever any associate raises a ticket for machine setup or for resolving any issues related to the machine, ensure that his/her location in GHD is set to TCS-Pune; SP-S2-Torna
  • Please ask the associate to enable and reset his/her Globe domain password in Ultimatix once Step 2 is completed.
  • Ensure that associate is aware that someone from IS team will connect with him/her for setting up the machine.Preferred means of communication by the IS team is TCS teams
  • Associate should NOT change his/her Globe password once the machine is setup
  • Associate should NEVER connect the machine to TCS VPN unless asked to do so by the IS team.
  • Associate should NOT be in possession of admin passwords and if available should NEVER use them without prior permission from his lead, location SDL and local IS.
  • Some machines dispatched from office come with a power on password.The power on password for the machine is Uknow It.

data.question: PROD VDI Setup?
data.answer:
1. Download VDI Request Form | Days required: 0
  2. AD Group request Steps for PROD VDI* | Days required: 2-4
  3. D2-TDBFG account Request Setup* | Days required: 1-3
  4. Request for VDI | Days required: 2-5
  5. Day 1 VDI Setup activities | Days required: 1-3
  6. Software requests from ServiceNow | Days required: 1-2
  7. Eclipse and VS Code request from ServiceNow | Days required: 1-2
  8. Map Symcore Shared Drive | Days required: 0
  9. Portable Software Setup | Days required: 0
  10. Beyond Trust Privilege Management Access Request* | Days required: 2-3
  11. Set Environment variable without Admin rights | Days required: 0
  12. Beyond Trust Software request | Days required: 1-2
  13. UI Environment Setup Guide | Days required: 0
  14. Install the Angular CLI and Grunt CLI Globally
  15. Node JS 10 and 6 setups
  16. Temporary Change NodeJS version
  17. NodeJS setup for Angular 9 and 6
  18. NodeJS Setup for AngularJS(1.5)
  19. PHP XAMPP Setup
  20. Install VS Code
  21. Setup VS Code Bash Terminal

data.question: How to install Eclipse and VS Code?
data.answer:
Note: Software installation process takes upto 3 days.
  1. Open a service catalogue.
  2. Select Software from the categories.
  3. Inside software go to the developer tool.
  4. Click on show more at the end of the page.
  5. Search for VS Code or Eclipse and click on the link.
  6. Fill the required field.
  7. Click on Add to cart.
  8. After adding click on order now.

data.question: What is AEM?
data.answer: AEM or the Adobe Experience Manager is a comprehensive content management tool. It efficiently builds and manages websites, forms, and mobile apps. The AEM is a part of the Adobe Marketing Cloud.

data.question: What is a component?
data.answer: In AEM, components are reusable modules that execute specific application logic to generate our website's content. The material available on your web pages is held, formatted, and rendered using AEM components. The components allow authors to change and configure content while creating pages. A JSP (Java Server Pages) or HTML file is frequently included in a component. HTML files provide the component's HTML markup as well as some business logic. A typical AEM page is made up of a lot of different elements. To put it another way, Components are the basic building blocks of AEM pages.

data.question: What is a template?
data.answer: A Template helps you to set a uniform style for your application's pages. It also specifies which components (reusable modules) are permitted to be used within the scope chosen. It's a tree of nodes with the same structure as the page you're going to make. It is devoid of any actual content. AEM offers static as well as editable templates.

data.question: What is sightly?
data.answer: Sightly is a Hypertext Template Language (HTL) specifically designed for AEM. It was introduced with AEM version 6.0. Sightly has been gaining importance because of it's various advantages for developing websites in AEM.

data.question: What is a workflow?
data.answer: AEM Workflows allows you to automate a series of steps that are performed on (one or more) pages and/or assets. For example, when publishing, an editor has to review the content - before a site administrator activates the page.

data.question: What is a workflow model?
data.answer: A WorkflowModel represents a definition (model) of a workflow. It is made of WorkflowNodes and WorkflowTransitions. The transitions connect the nodes and define the flow. The Model has always a start node and an end node.

data.question: What is OSGi?
data.answer: OSGi (Open Service Gateway Initiative) a dynamic modular architecture for Java applications that is the basis for Adobe Experience Manager. It is a fundamental element in the technology stack of AEM. It is used to control the composite bundles of AEM and their configuration. Read more: https://experienceleague.adobe.com/docs/experience-manager-learn/cloud-service/underlying-technology/introduction-osgi.html

data.question: What are client libraries?
data.answer: Client-Side Libraries provide a mechanism to organize and manage CSS and JavaScript files necessary for an AEM Sites implementation. AEM provides Client-side Library Folders, which allow you to store your client-side code in the repository, organize it into categories, and define when and how each category of code is to be served to the client.

data.question: What is a Servlet?
data.answer: A Servlet is a class used to extend the capabilities of servers that host applications accessed by means of a request-response programming model. For such applications, Servlet technology defines HTTP-specific servlet classes.All servlets must implement the Servlet interface, which defines life-cycle methods. A servlet in AEM can be registered as OSGi service: you can extend SlingSafeMethodsServlet for read-only implementation or SlingAllMethodsServlet in order to implement all RESTful operations.

data.question: What are Sling Models?
data.answer: Sling Models are annotation driven Java “POJO’s” (Plain Old Java Objects) that facilitate the mapping of data from the JCR to Java variables, and provide a number of other niceties when developing in the context of AEM.

data.question: How to Login to VDI from outsid'e Domain Network?
data.answer:
1. Using Internet Explorer 11 go to URL: https://prod.vdi.ras.tdbank.ca
  2. Sign in – Fill out given fields and click Log On
    • Username: Enter your TDBFG username
    • Password: Enter your TDBFG Password
    • Secure 'id' PASSCODE: Enter your PIN followed by the numbers on your RSA token
    • Domain: Select TDBFG
